summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in locked-down status across different tiers (G, H, J, K, M, L, ZB). The document is significant as it provides a procedural record from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Observation Checks
events.description: Staff at MCC New York's Special Housing Unit conducted mandatory 30-minute observation checks on inmates in administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, as documented on standardized check sheets for multiple tiers.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 8, 2019.
It details the mandatory 30-minute observation procedure for inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets cover multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, M, L, ZB), indicating a standard facility-wide procedure.
The document is a routine administrative record from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated.
Each sheet is reviewed and signed by a Lieutenant and a Captain, demonstrating a chain of accountability for inmate supervision.
